Hi,

I created a new branch for MultiCharacter #144 with small changes.
Basically, the interface is not changed.

I think renpy 7.0 will be released soon. Will it contain statement changes around Character?
If not, I think the current implementation is good for parallel speaking.

data.title: when passing two transform by 'at'
data.body:
Hi, I found small bug on "at" statement of renpy.

```
Renpy Ver.6.99
1280X720 MAC ver
```

For Example, when you define two transform as:

```
transform ani_left2center:
    parallel:
        xalign 0.2
        ease 0.8 xalign 0.5
    parallel:
        ypos 720
        ease 0.2 ypos 710
        ease 0.2 ypos 720
        ease 0.2 ypos 710
        ease 0.2 ypos 720

transform ani_fadein:
    alpha 0.0
    ease 0.6 alpha 1.0
```

...and use two transform same time with 'at' like this-

```
    show ch_sin upset at ani_left2center, ani_fadein
```

you will notice, when you use two transform at the sametime,
ch_sin moved 1 or 2 pixel less then ch_sin supposed to
(in this case, she have to be in center of screen, but she is more left for 1 or 2 pixel.)

But when you just use one transform with one 'at' statement like this:

```
    show ch_sin upset at ani_left2center
```

you will find ch_sin is perfectly on a center of screen.

data.title: Can't create a project using ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
When I move to create a new project I get a permission denied error,

I can understand why as it's trying to create a new folder in usr/share/games instead of ..games/renpy

Additionally, trying to change the projects directory didn't work as no launcher appears to edit this option

Issue is related to the use of the default DejaVuSans font.

My code related to text styling: http://puu.sh/hACQc.png

data.title: ATL sync issues inside LiveCompsites after being shown a second time
data.body:
Tested in 6.99.3.404 and 6.99.1.329

When showing a LiveComposite which contains ATL, the contained ATL objects don't seem to reset properly between show/hides.

To repro, lets start with some ATL in init. You can copy/paste this into the tutorial for ease of use.

```
    image DemoComposite = LiveComposite(
        (266,600),
        (0,0), "DemoCompA",
        (0,0), "DemoCompB",
        (0,0), "DemoCompC",
        )


    transform DemoLoop:
        easein 0.5 alpha 1
        easeout 0.5 alpha 0
        0.5
        repeat

    image DemoCompA:
            "target1.png"
            alpha 0
            DemoLoop

    image DemoCompB:
            "target2.png"
            alpha 0
            0.5
            DemoLoop

    image DemoCompC:
            "star.png"
            alpha 0
            1.0
            DemoLoop
```

Now, if we go into a scene and just do a normal

```
    show DemoCompA
    show DemoCompB
    show DemoCompC
```

everything works as expected. When we scroll back or hit the block a second time, everything remains in sync. The three images will smoothly crossfade 0.5 seconds apart.

However, if we decide we want to use the LiveComposite with `show DemoComposite`, we will see the correct behavior the first time, but subsequent shows will be randomly out of sync. This seems to occur both when scrolling back, and when explicitly show/hide/showing.

data.title: enhancement req: Method for passing more params to char func
data.body:
"Narrator speaking",extra=True -> $ narrator("Narrator speaking",extra=True)
charfunc "Character speaking",extra=True -> $ charfunc("Character speaking",extra=True)

Not useful for default Ren'py, but makes things much neater for when Character is wrapped and extra parameters need to be passed.

data.title: renpy.watch(), and renpy.unwatch()
data.body:
renpy.watch() should just import what's in _console. And renpy.unwatch() should somehow exist along the same lines to use _console.unwatch(), but renpy.watch() expects a string, whereas _console builds a lexer for _console.watch() to take.

So getting renpy.watch() to send _console.watch() doesn't look super-trivial, sadly. Once stringToLexer() or something is functional, the rest should be trivial.

data.title: Add renpy.reset_physical_size()
data.body: While this is trivial code, it just makes sense to me that Ren'Py has this (at least, as opposed to not having it). As a complement to renpy.set_physical_size(), anyhow.

http://www.renpy.org/doc/html/text.html

"{color=#f00}Red{/color}, {color=#00ff00}Green{color}, {color=#0000ffff}Blue{/color}"

Green has {color} instead of {/color}

data.title: canvas drawing not working
data.body:
tests as working in older ren'py

```
init python:

    class TestDisplayable(renpy.Displayable):
        def render(self,width,height,st,at):
            R = renpy.Render(width,height)
            C = R.canvas()
            C.aaline((0,0,255,0),(100,100),(200,200))
            C.aaline((0,0,255,0),(100,200),(200,100))
            return R

screen TestScreen:
    add TestDisplayable()

label start:

    scene expression "#FFF"
    show screen TestScreen
```

data.title: Scoping issues when showing two screens
data.body:
I've noticed that when Ren'Py shows a new screen it creates a new instance of existing screens, however, Python code accessing variables in the scope of the existing screen still refer to the old instance. This breaks things like `SetScreenVariable`.

Here's a minimal test case that reproduces the issue in the latest commit on master (https://github.com/renpy/renpy/commit/40805225bd848db72135ff35a9023258aa21fc97):

``` python
screen test1():
    default offset = 0
    zorder 1
    textbutton "Click":
        hovered SetScreenVariable("offset", 20)
        unhovered SetScreenVariable("offset", 0)
        action Show("test2")
        xoffset offset
        xalign 0.5 yalign 0.5

screen test2():
    zorder 2
    textbutton "Close" action Hide("test2")

label start:
    show screen test
    "..."
```

To reproduce it:
- Hover the button in the test1 screen, the offset variable should affect the button's position;
- Click the button in the test1 screen;
- Hover the button in the test1 screen, the offset variable does not affect the button's position anymore;
- Hide the test2 screen;
- Hover the button in the test1 screen, the offset variable still does not affect the button's position;
